venue.title: Le Querce di Mamre
venue.blurb: Nestled in the heart of Apulia, Le Querce di Mamre is a timeless sanctuary of Mediterranean beauty. Surrounded by ancient olive trees, this venue combines rustic charm with refined elegance, providing the perfect backdrop for our celebration.

ceremony.title: The Ceremony
ceremony.desc: Join us as we exchange our vows under the shade of ancient olive trees in a heartfelt outdoor ceremony.

entrees.title: Entrées & Apertifs
entrees.desc: Enjoy a selection of traditional Apulian starters and refreshments in the garden, accompanied by gentle music.

lunch.title: Lunch & Party
lunch.desc: We move inside for an authentic Italian wedding feast, dancing, and celebration with our loved ones.

cake.title: Cake Cutting
cake.desc: A sweet moment as we cut our wedding cake together, marking the start of a magical evening under the stars.

afterparty.title: After Party & Open Bar
afterparty.desc: The celebration continues with an open bar and high-energy music to dance the night away until late.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.oneliner: Most answers can be found on the rest of the website, but this page is as comprehensive as possible to allow for easy searching.

questions.where_ceremony_a: The civil ceremony will be held outdoors at the Querce di Mamre, Apulia, in the courtyard.
questions.where_reception_a: The reception will be held outside. Please refer to the <runOfShowLink>Run of Show</runOfShowLink> page for detailed information.
questions.arrival_time_a: We recommend arriving by 12:00 PM to find your seat comfortably before the 12:30 PM ceremony.
questions.dress_code_a: While we appreciate everyone's freedom of expression, during weddings in Italy, guests are expected to dress to impress. Furthermore, it is frowned upon for women to dress in white.
questions.bathing_suit: Do I need a bathing suit?
questions.bathing_suit_a: Unfortunately not. Swimming in the pool at the venue is strictly prohibited.
questions.jacket: Do I need a jacket for the evening?
questions.jacket_a: While it can get very hot during the day, it might get chilly as it gets dark. Nothing dramatic, but maybe something to cover the shoulders.
questions.how_rsvp_a: You can RSVP directly on this website through the <rsvpLink>RSVP</rsvpLink> page.
questions.rsvp_deadline_a: For logistic reasons, we kindly ask you to confirm your presence by March 31st, 2026.
questions.plus_one: Can I bring a plus one?
questions.plus_one_a: Plus ones are welcome as long as we know by the deadline above. If you meet someone between March and June, your plus one is welcome to come as long as you let us know by May 31st.
questions.children_a: Children are welcome! There will be a babysitter to look after kids 3 years and plus. We kindly ask you still keep an eye on them for the safety of the workers and dancing people.
questions.where_to_go_a: While the event is in Le Querce di Mamre, we recommend everyone to book accommodation in Apricena or San Severo, in the province of Foggia (FG), where we will be staying as well. It's a 30m drive from the venue.
questions.how_get_there_a: The nearest airports are Bari-Palese (BRI) and Pescara (PSR). Naples airport (NAP) is an option, but it will take an hour longer. See the <travelLink>Travel & Accommodations</travelLink> page for details.
questions.car_rental: Where do I rent a car?
questions.car_rental_a: Placeholder: We recommend renting from reputable agencies at the airport.
questions.venue_transport: How do I get to the venue?
questions.venue_transport_a: We are organizing shuttles to go and return so that guests can drink without worry. If you wish to drive, you are welcome to do so.
questions.parking_a: Yes, there is ample complimentary parking available at the venue.
questions.hotels_a: Yes, there are hotels and B&Bs. We recommend booking as soon as possible as availability is limited.
questions.gifts_expected_a: Your presence is the greatest gift. If you wish to give something, please check our <registryLink>Registry</registryLink> page.
questions.registry_a: We don't have a traditional registry, but everything you need to know is on the <registryLink>Registry</registryLink> page.
questions.unplugged_a: As there will be a professional photographer to document the ceremony, we ask you to refrain from taking pictures or videos yourself. This will allow you to be fully present with us.
questions.take_photos: Can we take photos the rest of the day?
questions.take_photos_a: Yes, absolutely! You are welcome to take photos during the rest of the day.
questions.schedule_a: The full schedule can be found on the <runOfShowLink>Run of Show</runOfShowLink> page.
questions.reception_end: What time will the day end?
questions.reception_end_a: We expect the day to end at around 11pm.
questions.expected_weather_a: While weather can sometimes be unpredictable, June in Apulia can be very hot with temperatures reaching 35°C. We recommend checking temperatures ahead of time and dressing accordingly.
questions.rain_a: No panic! We have an indoor backup plan at the same venue, so the celebration will go on regardless of the weather!
questions.traditions: Will there be religious or cultural traditions guests should know about?
questions.traditions_a: There won't be a religious ceremony. However, we ask everyone to be quiet during the civil ceremony. Women should avoid dressing in white as only the bride should be dressed in white.

pescara.name: Pescara Airport (PSR)
pescara.desc: Approximately 1 hour 30 minutes drive to Apricena. A smaller airport with fewer connections but closer to our home base.

bari.name: Bari Airport (BRI)
bari.desc: The largest international airport in the region with the most flight options. Approximately 1 hour 45 minutes drive to Apricena.

toCity.title: Getting to Apricena
toCity.desc: We'll be staying in Apricena, a charming town in the Gargano area and the hometown of the bride. Here are your options to get there from the airports:
toCity.rentalDesc: Recommended for flexibility. Rent directly at the airport.
toCity.taxiDesc: Expect taxis to be available only between airport and train stations.
toCity.trainDesc: Direct trains are available from Pescara Centrale station and Bari Centrale station to San Severo or Foggia. Timetable can be found on the Trenitalia website.

toVenue.title: Getting to the Venue
toVenue.desc: The wedding venue is a short drive from Apricena:
toVenue.fromApricenaDesc: The wedding is in Querce di Mamre and google maps is reliable to get there.
toVenue.parkingDesc: Free parking is available at the venue for all guests.

hotel.name: Hotel Options
hotel.desc: Several hotels available in and around Apricena. Recommended for those who prefer full amenities and daily housekeeping.
hotel.examples: Hotel Palazzo, Hotel Sant'Angelo, and others in the area

bnb.name: B&B / Agriturismo
bnb.desc: Experience authentic Apulian hospitality at local bed & breakfasts or farm stays. Often more charming and budget-friendly.
bnb.examples: Agriturismo options and local B&Bs in the countryside

beaches.title: Beaches & Coastline
beaches.desc: The Gargano coast offers some of Italy's most beautiful beaches and seaside towns.

rodi.title: Rodi Garganico
rodi.desc: Picturesque seaside town known for its citrus groves and long sandy beaches.

vieste.title: Vieste
vieste.desc: Charming coastal town with beautiful beaches and dramatic sea stacks.

peschici.title: Peschici
peschici.desc: Picturesque whitewashed village perched on cliffs with panoramic sea views.

towns.title: More in Apulia
towns.desc: Explore the charming historic towns of Apulia, each with unique character and history.

alberobello.title: Alberobello
alberobello.desc: Famous for its Trulli houses — unique cone-shaped dwellings and a UNESCO World Heritage site.
alberobello.tip: Tip: Visit early morning or late afternoon to avoid crowds.

ostuni.title: Ostuni
ostuni.desc: Known as the 'White City' for its whitewashed old town with winding medieval streets.
ostuni.tip: Tip: The sunset views from the cathedral are spectacular.

polignano.title: Polignano a Mare
polignano.desc: Stunning cliffs and crystal-clear waters. Famous for its beach restaurant on a sea cave.

nature.title: Nature & Outdoors
nature.desc: The Gargano National Park offers incredible natural beauty and outdoor activities.

forest.title: Forest Umbra
forest.desc: Ancient beech and oak forest perfect for hiking and nature walks.

caves.title: Castellana Caves
caves.desc: Spectacular underground karst cave system with guided tours available.

tremiti.title: Tremiti Islands
tremiti.desc: Beautiful archipelago accessible by ferry. Perfect for day trips and snorkeling.

wine.title: Wine Tasting
wine.desc: Apulia is famous for its wines. Here are some of our favorite places to taste them.

mandrione.name: Tenute Il Mandrione
mandrione.desc: Offers tours and tastings of Primitivo, Montepulciano, and Bombino Bianco wines, plus olive oil, often with local foods, in a stunning setting by the Umbra Forest.

merinum.name: Cantine Merinum
merinum.desc: Known for great wine tastings with complementary food and vineyard tours, providing a full sensory experience. Located at Tenuta Padre Pio.

arapri.name: Cantina D'Araprì
arapri.desc: Specializes in classic method sparkling wines (Bombino Bianco, Nero di Troia) with cellar tours and tastings.

food.title: More Recommendations
food.desc: Looking for even more things to do?

experts.title: Listen to the experts!
experts.desc: There are so many things to do in the area, that it would be impossible to list them all here. We do recommend reading online (pages like VisitVieste.com) and picking local sources rather than instagram influencers. Please ask if you have questions!

money.title: Money Matters
money.desc: A few practical tips about payments and tipping in Italy.

currency.title: Currency - Euro (€)
currency.desc: Small payments are cash-only! That said, debit/credit card are usually accepted (not AMEX).
currency.tip: Tip: Always carry some cash, just to be safe. You can never know when a POS breaks... *wink*

tipping.title: Tipping
tipping.desc: Tipping is appreciated but not mandatory. Service is usually included in the bill.
tipping.amount: Tips are not % based, but you can leave some Euros for excellent service.

weather.title: Weather & What to Pack
weather.desc: June is beautiful in Apulia! Here's what to expect and pack.

june.title: June Weather
june.desc: Sunny and warm (25-35°C / 77-95°F). Perfect for outdoor celebrations!

packing.title: Clothes to Pack
packing.desc: Beyond essentials like swimwear and sandals, bring a light layer for cooler evenings. Hiking shoes are recommended if you plan to explore nature.

customs.title: Italian Customs
customs.desc: Embrace the local rhythm and dining traditions.

riposo.title: The Riposo (Afternoon Break)
riposo.desc: Many shops and businesses close between 1pm-5pm. This is the traditional Italian afternoon break.
riposo.hours: Keep in mind that Google's opening times might not be super accurate in smaller towns.

dining.title: Meals & Eating
dining.desc: Enjoy breakfast in a local bar with a cornetto and an espresso! Also, dinner on average happens starting 7:30pm.
dining.reservations: Tip: In popular towns, you should try and book restaurants in advance.

safety.title: Safety & Thievery
safety.desc: Apart from the normal advice that applies anywhere to not go into dark alleyways, cars should never ever be left unlocked or with items visible from the outside.

transportation.title: Transportation
transportation.desc: Buses and trains are available, but we recommend renting a car to explore the best beaches and hidden gems.

beaches.title: Beaches
beaches.desc: Most beaches are private lidos: they will provide you with a beach umbrella and deckchairs for a fee. Look for 'spiaggia libera' for free beaches.

food.title: Food & Drink
food.desc: Apulian cuisine is incredible! Don't miss these local specialties.

specialties.title: Must-Try Dishes
specialties.desc: Orecchiette pasta, burrata cheese, fresh seafood, and focaccia are regional highlights. Staying in Apricena? Try the gelato at Excelsior Bar (Corso Roma) and desserts at Pasticceria d'Autore.
specialties.examples: Look for: orecchiette con cime di rapa, polignano-style seafood, and pasticciotto for breakfast!

wine.title: Local Wines
wine.desc: Puglia's typical wines are full-bodied, fruit-forward reds from grapes like Primitivo (like Zinfandel, rich & spicy) and Negroamaro (deep, slightly bitter, backbone of Salice Salentino), alongside aromatic whites like Verdeca and Fiano, and excellent dry rosés (rosato) from Negroamaro. Key regions include Manduria for Primitivo and Salento for Negroamaro, with standout appellations like Primitivo di Manduria DOC, Salice Salentino DOC, and Castel del Monte (often Nero di Troia).
wine.note: Ask for local recommendations — the wine here is fantastic and very affordable!

registry.title: Registry
registry.desc: Gifts are never expected, but always appreciated.
registry.presence_title: Your Presence is Our Greatest Gift
registry.presence_text: The most important thing for us is having you there to celebrate our special day. Your presence, laughter, and love are all we truly desire.
registry.honeymoon_text: If you wish to honor us with something more, a contribution towards our honeymoon adventures would mean the world. We're planning an unforgettable trip to New Zealand and French Polynesia to create memories that will last a lifetime.
registry.thankyou: Thank you for your love and generosity.

dress_code.title: Dress Code
dress_code.desc: The dress code for our wedding is Formal / Black Tie Optional.
dress_code.gentlemen: Gentlemen are invited to wear a suit or tuxedo.
dress_code.ladies: Ladies are invited to wear a floor-length gown or a formal cocktail dress.
dress_code.note: The ceremony and drinks will be held on grass, so please choose your footwear accordingly.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.desc: If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to us directly.
